CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 6, 1941, pg. 10, reads: "Glamorous Scenes as Society Turns Out To See "Aida" - Highlight of the National Association of Musicians' convention in Pittsburgh was the performance of the great opera, "Aida" by an entire Negro cast...SiLita Haley...Mae Vajda, wife of the director, Maestro Frederick Vajda... - Photos by Harris and Lewis."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mae Vajda, wife of director Frederick Vajda, in Syria Mosque for National Negro Opera Company performance of "Aida"
